page.title: 17A PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content: The Farmer's Home. This building is now a Public House and was built in 1380.Previously it has been a bakery,a slaughter house, and a farm house. This is most probably where the name comes from. The Brewery that owns the Pub is Whitbreads. They sell beer,spirits, wine and liqueurs.They also sell snacks and meals. On the outside of the Pub ther are three different types of brickwork. This suggests that parts of the Pub were built at different times. There is a garden in which there is a swing, a slide and an aviary with thirteen birds in it. Outside the Pub there are many objects from the past such as a baker's peel from the bakery and a hand plough from the farm.
